greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of the real part of the complex roots of x^3-x^2+1.
comment: The real root is A075778 (negated). The imaginary parts are plus or minus A210463.
Real root of 8x^3 - 8x^2 + 2x - 1: an algebraic number of degree 3. - _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Apr 14 2014
The denominator of this algebraic number is 2, since its double is an algebraic integer. - _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Nov 12 2014
results.author: _R. J. Mathar_, Jan 22 2013
